Award.AwardTitle: Center For The Advancement Of Informal Science Education Renewal

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
The Center for Advancement of Informal Science Education (CAISE), a cooperative agreement with NSF, is a partnership of the Association of Science-Technology Centers with faculty and professionals from the University of Pittsburgh Center for Learning in Out-of-School Environments, Oregon State University, Science Museum of Minnesota, Visitor Studies Association, KQED Public Media, Advisors and other collaborators. CAISE is working to support ongoing improvement of, and NSF investments in, the national infrastructure for informal Science Technology Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) education.

CAISE is building capacity and supporting continued professionalization for the field, fostering a community of practice that bridges the many varied forms in which informal STEM experiences are developed and delivered for learners of all ages. To that end, CAISE activities are also: creating field-driven evidence databases about the impacts of informal STEM education; facilitating federated searches of databases; stimulating discussions about important learning research agendas for the field; furthering knowledge transfer between learning research and practice; working to improve evaluation knowledge and processes; and helping STEM researchers improve their efforts in informal STEM education and communication.

For Principal Investigators (PIs) and potential PIs, CAISE provides resources that help them as they develop evidence-based ideas and proposals. It also catalyzes and strengthens networks through PI meetings, communications, and other methods that encourage sharing of deliverables, practices, and findings across projects.

For the ISE Program at NSF, CAISE is assisting Program Officers in understanding the portfolio of awards, identifying the portfolio's impacts in key areas, and integrating the program's investments in education infrastructure.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Center for Advancement of Informal Science Education (CAISE) is a project charged with providing resources and infrastructure for the field of informal Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) education.The primary audience for the project includes professional institutions, organizations and individuals who design, evaluate and research informal STEM learning experiences and settings.These settings include but are not limited to science museums and centers, media in all of its forms (film, television, radio, podcasts, etc.), cyberlearning platforms, citizen science projects and programs, afterschool, out-of-school-time, youth and community programs, events such as science festivals and cafes and science communication writing online and in print.

CAISE began its work by focusing on the portfolio of National Science Foundation Advancing Informal STEM Learning (AISL) program-funded projects and increasingly widened its lens to convene, connect and characterize the wider informal science education (ISE) field. As the project evolved it also began to include STEM researchers and those who design education, communication and engagement activities as part of the outreach or broader impacts efforts connected to their scientific research.

CAISE focuses its activities around 4 initiatives:

  • Exploring and supporting the integration of ISE practice and research
  • Building capacity for ISE evaluation and measurement
  • Investigating and strengthening connections between informal STEM education and the outreach, engagement and broader impacts activities of scientists, graduate students, fellows and science communicators
  • Creating digital infrastructure and curating and organizing a database of project abstracts, evaluation reports and research materials that provide examples of evidence-based ISE practice

CAISE communicates the outputs, outcomes, findings and results of its initiatives through monthly e-mailed newsletters, social media and daily updated news, views and other posts on its InformalScience.org website.

In addition to collecting, curating and disseminating work from all corners of the field, CAISE also creates resources and compiles materials of its own, including the 2016 report Informal STEM Education: Resources for Outreach, Engagement and Broader Impacts.

For further information about the Center for Advancement of Informal Science Education (CAISE) project team, activities and products, visit the Center's project page here.
